c74object.name: bach.nearest
c74object.digest: Snap numbers to nearest elements of an llll
c74object.description: Snaps each number of an incoming llll to the nearest number of a given reference plain llll. The snapped elements are output, as well as their distances to the original elements and the indices of the chosen elements in the reference llll.

inlet.digest: The llll whose elements must be snapped

outlet.digest: The llll containing indices of snapped elements
The llll containing distances between snapped elements and original ones

objarg.name: reference_grid
objarg.description: The optional argument sets the initial reference plain llll (or "grid") to which each incoming elements should be snapped.

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs the snapping on the most received input lllls.

method.name: llll
method.description:
An llll in the first inlet will be considered as the llll whose elements have to be snapped to the reference llll. Elements are snapped, and the list of the nearest elements (shaped as the original) is output from the first outlet. Before that, the list of distances of snapped elements with the original ones is output from the third outlet, and the llll containing for each element the index of its nearest element in the reference llll is output from the second outlet. All lllls have the same structure as the original llll.
An llll in the second inlet is considered to be the reference plain llll ("grid") to which elements should be snapped.

attribute.name: absolute
attribute.description: If the absolute attribute is set to 1 (default), absolute distances are output from the third outlet (see llll method), otherwise differences between the snapped elements and the original ones are output.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: The llll whose elements must be snapped.

entry.name: Outlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: The llll containing indices of snapped elements.

entry.name: Outlet 3 (llll)
entry.description: The llll containing distances between snapped elements and original ones.
